caption.p: List of the plants reported to have antistress (adaptogenic) activity and used in traditional medicinal systems as rejuvenating medicinal plants, qi tonics, rasayanas, or restoratives

tr.th: Plants reported in Literature as adaptogens (1)* and for antistressa
References supporting such use in specific medical systems

tr.td: Aralia elata var. mandshurica (Rupr. & Maxim.) J.Wen (syn. Aralia mandshurica Rupr. & Maxim)
Aralia cordata var. sachalinensis (Regel) Nakai (syn. Aralia schmidtiiPojark.)
Argyreia nervosa (Burm. f.) Bojer (syn. Argyreia speciosa (L. f.) Sweet)
Clematis alpina subsp. sibirica (L.) Kuntze (syn. Atragene sibirica L.)
Diospyros malabarica (Desr.) Kostel. (Syn. Diospyros peregrina (Gaertn.) Gürke)
Elaeagnus rhamnoides (L.) A.Nelson. (Syn. Hippophae rhamnoides L.)
Eleutherococcus sessiliflorus (Rupr. & Maxim.) S.Y. Hu (syn Acanthopanax sessiliflorus (Rupr. & Maxim.) Seem.)
Firmiana simplex (L.) W. Wight (Syn Sterculia plantanifolia L.)
Hebanthe eriantha (Poir.) Pedersen (Syn. Pfaffia paniculata (Mart.) Kuntze)
Justicia diffusa Willd. (Syn Rostellularia diffusa (Willd.) Nees.)
Lepidium meyenii Walp. (Syn. Lepidium peruvianum G.Chacón)
Marantodes pumilum (Blume) Kuntze. (Syn. Labisia pumila (Blume) Mez)
Mitragyna inermis (Willd.) Kuntze (Syn Mitragyna africana (Willd.) Korth.)
Ocimum tenuiflorum L. (Syn. Ocimum sanctum L.)
Oplopanax elatus (Nakai) Nakai (Syn. Echinopanax elatum Nakai)
Pandanus odorifer (Forssk.) Kuntze (Syn. Pandanus odoratissimus L.f.)
Putranjiva roxburghii Wall. (Syn. Drypetes roxburghii (Wall.) Hurus.)
Polyscias filicifolia ( C.Moore ex E.Fourn.) L.H.Bailey
Rhodiola rosea L. [today classed as Sedum roseum (L.) Scop.]
Serratula tinctoria L. (Syn. Serratula inermis Poir.)
Syzygium aromaticum (L.) Merr. & L.M.Perry. (Syn. Eugenia caryophyllus (Spreng.) Bullock & S.G.Harrison)
Tinospora sinensis (Lour.) Merr. (Syn. Tinospora cordifolia (Willd.) Miers, Syn Tinospora malabarica (Lam.) Hook. f. & Thomson)
Trichopodium zeylanicum (Gaertn.) Thwaites (Syn. Trichopus zeylanicus Gaertn.)
